author: Staff Reporter
text:
People for Cattle in India, an NGO that promotes animal welfare, is inviting all residents to quench the thirst of animals this summer through a ‘water bowl challenge’, a press release said.

The aim of the challenge is to encourage people to place water bowls in their houses, terraces, balconies, gardens and streets for animals and birds. Thousands of birds and animals die due to lack of access to water, the release said.

The challenge begins on March 13 at Heart2Heart Veterinary Hospital, No-3, Leith Castle Center Street, Santhome (opposite IG Office-Registration) from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

For details, contact: People For Cattle in India, 8/22, Ragaviah Road, T.Nagar, Chennai-17 or 98840 71136.
title: Take the water bowl challenge, this summer
